byline.contributor: Timothy Williams contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Justice Dept's Office of Community Oriented Policing Services releases report criticizing San Francisco Police Dept for bias against blacks and Latinos; report, done at request of Mayor Edwin M Lee following fatal police shooting of African-American Mario Woods in 2015, cites significant deficiencies in department and makes 272 recommendations; among them is proposal that city create inspector general’s office to oversee department.
lead_paragraph: A report finds a 24 percent higher chance that African-Americans are pulled over by the police given the estimated number of black drivers in the city.
snippet: A report finds a 24 percent higher chance that African-Americans are pulled over by the police given the estimated number of black drivers in the city....

headline.main: U.S. Cites Bias by San Francisco Police Against Blacks
headline.print_headline: U.S. Cites Bias Against Blacks  by the Police in San Francisco
